Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement that Hillary Clinton donned a hijab for a new campaign ad.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that wearing a hijab is an act of submission, without considering the cultural and religious significance of the garment.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the claim, as the image of Hillary Clinton wearing a hijab was taken out of context from a video showing her meeting with foreign dignitaries in her role as Secretary of State, where wearing a head covering was expected by custom.
Understate: The claim may understate the significance and context of the image by suggesting it was part of her ordinary attire in a campaign ad, when it was actually a brief segment from a video compilation.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image was not from a new campaign ad, as it was originally shared in October 2015 and was taken out of context.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
